intro: Philibertia odorata, commonly known as the sweet salsify, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers that develop into long, slender fruits. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas. Philibertia odorata is valued for its edible roots and has been used in traditional medicine.
